result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. Igl

defendant.name: Igl, William J.
defendant.address: W10699 Enterprise Lake Road, Elcho, WI 54428

records.addlTxt: Court calls 20CF106, 20CM28, 20CM7, 20CM32, 20CF46 & 22CF95 @ 11:11 AM/Room 201 Defendant William J. Igl appeared by video, in custody from Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Richard E. Bender in court for William J. Igl.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Def. can hear all parties and agrees to continue hearing via zoom. State gives plea agreement, Waiver of p.h. 20CF106 20CF46, 22CF95 DRI, 20CM32 plea, 20CF106 Ct 1, DRI CT 2, 20CM28 DRI, 20CF46 plea to Ct 1, 2 & 3, DRI Ct's4 & 5, 20CM7 DRI, 3 citations have been paid, 20tr234, 20TR235 & 20TR236, 20CM32 30 day jail, consecutive, costs, DNA, 20CF106 Ct 1 1 year jail, stay 3 years probation, costs, DNA, AODA, Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counseling as deemed necessary, 20cf46 ct 1 withhelde sentence 3 years concurrent, costs, DNA comply in 20CF106, ct 2 3 months jail, stay 2 years probation, costs, comply with conditions, ct 3 6 months jail, stay 2 years probation, costs, DNA, comply with conditions in 20CF46 Information with be file electronically. State has complied with victim rights. Victim does not want to address court today.  Atty Bender and def. agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire was filed but 20CF106 was not on form but went over with def. in breakout.  Atty Bender request to waive p.h. Def. questions agreement but now understands. 20CF106 & 20CF46 Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Atty Bender has copy of informations.  State is filing informations electronically and mirrors complaint.  Atty Bender waives reading of information. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed and gone over with def.  Def. advised of charges and penalties. 20CM32 Bail jumping, no contest plea, 20CF106 Ct 1 Bail jumping, no contest plea,  20CF46 Ct 1 Poss of Meth, near certain place, no contest plea, Ct 2 Poss of THC 2nd, nears certain place, no contest plea, Ct 3 Child Neglect, no contest plea,  Court grants State motion to DRI in 22CF95, 20CF106 Ct 2, 20CM28, 20CF46 Ct's 4 & 5 DRI & 20CM7. Court heard on near a school, 200 hours of community service will need to be ordered.  Def. agrees with community service. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understands elements. Def. admits prior conviction. Def. makes statement.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen. Def. not sure if understanding. Court questions def. Def. understands since Judge explained.  Atty Bender is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis. Atty Bender heard on one issue 20CM32 3 days of credit, and heard on 30 days jail ordered, State interrupts Atty Bender,  Court will be heard on credit @ end. Court finds factual basis, accept pleas and finds def. Guilty to 20CM32 Bail jumping, 20CF106 Ct 1 Bail jumping, & 20CF46 Ct 1 Poss of Meth, near certain place, Ct 2 Poss of THC 2nd, nears certain place, & Ct 3 Child Neglect. State gives sentencing remarks. Atty Bender gives sentencing remarks. Def. has nothing to say. Court gives factors and orders abide with plea agreement  20CM32 Ct 1 - 30 days jail, huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence ordered today,  costs, $200 DNA surcharge/Sample. 20CF106 Ct 1 - impose 1 years jail, huber privileges,consecutive stay 3 years probation, costs, $250 DNA Surcharge/Sample, completions of AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, Counseling as deemed beneficial by agent.20CF46 Ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, $250 DNA surcharge, comply with conditions 20CF106, 100 hours community service, ct 2 impose 3 months jail, huber privileges,consecutive to any sentence ordered today stay 2 years probation, costs, $250 DNA surcharge, Comply with conditions 20cf106. 100 hours community service. ct 3 impose 6 months jail, huber privileges, consecutive to any sentence ordered today stay 2 years probation, costs $200 DNA Surcharge comply with conditions. State heard on credit. Atty Bender agrees with State.  Victim heard on TRO in Wood Co. Judge can't address different county TRO.  credit 20CF106 0 days, 20CM32 3 days, & 27 days 22CF95, Time served 20CM32,  79 days from 22CF95 applied to 20CF46, 20 CF46 7 days on this case. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. 20CM32 bond applied, and given p.p. Atty Bender heard on good time.  Court does not figure good time when giving credit. 20CF46 bond applied to costs and balance returned to poster.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of post conviction rights.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no contact with alleged victim or alleged victims residence.

2:48 PM Defendant William J. Igl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard E. Bender appeared by video for William J. Igl.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. Victim did not appear. Court calls cases 22CF95, 20CM32, 20CM28, 20CM7, 20CM46, and 20CF106. Attorney Bender gives bail bond reduction argument. Defendant gives statement. Attorney Bender requests signature bond. The DA gives bail bond argument and objects. DA requests to maintain current a cash bond. Attorney Bender questions DA and responds. Court gives ruling. Court orders a cash bond of $20,000 on case 22CF95 with conditions in the previous bond of Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no contact with alleged victim or alleged victims residence. Court will not modify the contact of the victim. Attorney Bender questions the court. Court is adjourned. Status conference is previously scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 11:00 AM.

Notice & Motion for Reduction of Bond and Revision of Condition of Release
Routed to CC-JA

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:37 PM Defendant William J. Igl in court with attorney Richard E. Bender.  Defendant William J. Igl in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William J. Igl appeared by video means with Attorney. All parties vai zoom.  Atty Bender has copy of complaint, waives reading and waives time limit limits for p.h.  Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h.  Atty Bender would like to be heard on bond. Victim is present in courtroom.  Court advise Atty Bender to file written motion.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:12 PM Defendant William J. Igl in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William J. Igl appeared by video means, via zoom.  Court review history of case. Def. wants to continue to wait for atty to be appointed. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with alleged victim or alleged victims residence.

03:32 PM Defendant William J. Igl in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William J. Igl appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. will contact P.D. State is in compliance with victim rights. State gives bail/bond recommendation $10,000  cash bond with conditions  Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with alleged victim or their residence.  Def. makes statement. Court gives 3 factors for setting bond & orders $25,0000 cash bond with conditions conditions   Maintain Absolute Sobriety.No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with alleged victim or alleged victim residence.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
